speakers.companyProfile:
• 

Industry Overview and Digital Transformation: Insurtech, which combines insurance and technology, is reshaping the traditional insurance industry, which has undergone significant transformation in recent years.

• 

Key Technology Trends: AI and Machine Learning:
- Since 2023, generative AI has become mainstream in insurance, helping automate tasks like underwriting, claims technology, fraud detection, and customer support
- According to a recent survey, 78% of insurance organizations plan to increase tech spending in 2025, with AI being the top priority (36%), followed by big data and analytics (28%), and cloud infrastructure (26%) Data Analytics and Automation:
- For enterprise fintech and SaaS leaders, the focus is on blending technology innovation with strategy, using AI, IoT, and data analytics to automate back-office processes and deliver personalized experiences 3.

Market Innovation and Products: Digital Insurance Platforms:
- Digital-first insurance brokers and platforms offer insurance products online, simplifying comparison and purchasing through user-friendly interfaces and personalized recommendations.

These platforms use data analytics to match customers with appropriate coverage options instantly New Insurance Models:
- Peer-to-peer insurtech models pool premiums from groups of individuals to insure against shared risks. In some models, unclaimed money returns to members or charity, fostering community-based insurance. Lemonade was an early developer of this model 4.

Leading Companies and Solutions: Notable Players:
- Bestow, founded in 2016 and headquartered in Dallas, offers an end-to-end software platform helping life insurers streamline operations, reduce costs, and boost profitability across the entire value chain.

They enable carriers to launch, manage, and scale life insurance products efficiently - BriteCore provides P&C insurers with a cloud-native core insurance platform for managing policies, billing, and claims, with rapid product configuration capabilities and comprehensive reporting. They serve over 100 insurers across North America 5. Industry Challenges: Regulatory and Compliance:
- Insurtech startups face significant challenges in staying compliant with regulations. The insurance industry is heavily regulated, with each country and region having its own laws.

Compliance requires substantial resources and expertise, particularly challenging for startups with limited resources Technology Integration:
- Integration of new technologies with existing insurance systems presents both technical and financial challenges.

Many traditional insurers use outdated systems that aren't easily compatible with modern technologies, creating significant problems for startups looking to innovate and provide seamless, tech-based solutions. These integration challenges can slow down new technology deployment and limit collaboration with established insurers 6. Future Outlook: - The insurance industry is approaching a major technological evolution, driven by economic uncertainty and changing risk profiles due to climate change. Insurers must handle increasing complexity in product offerings and new regulations.

• 

Market Overview and Growth:
The insurance industry is currently undergoing rapid digital transformation, driven by technological innovations in AI, automation, and data integration. The global insurtech market, valued at $5. 3 billion in 2024, is projected to reach $132. 9 billion by 2034.

• 

Key Technologies and Innovations:
- Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning:
AI and ML technologies are enhancing insurance processes through:
- More accurate risk evaluations and customized pricing models
- Revolutionary underwriting processes that analyze large datasets
- Creation of more precise risk assessments and personalized insurance products - Claims Processing:
By 2025, it's estimated that 50% of claims will be automated using AI and Machine Learning techniques.

This automation accelerates decision-making, leading to better customer experiences and results in high-volume, low-cost insurance claims.

• 

Market Impact and Benefits:
Insurtech has brought several benefits including:
- Enhanced customer experience
- 24/7 availability through AI-powered chatbots 4.

Industry Transformation:
Modern insurtech platforms offer:
- Digital-first insurance products online
- Simplified comparison and purchasing
- User-friendly interfaces
- Personalized recommendations
- Instant coverage matching using data analytics 5. Types of Insurance Innovation:
The industry has developed various innovative models including:
- Telematics and usage-based insurance for auto premiums
- Dynamic pricing based on real-time data from connected devices
- Parametric insurance with predetermined payouts based on specific parameters 6.

Market Competition and Growth:
Currently, there are approximately 1,500 insurtech startups operating globally.

These companies are leading a transformative era in the sector, addressing evolving demands for seamless, cost-effective insurance solutions. The global market is expected to reach $166 billion by 2030.

• 

Investment and Unicorn Status:
Companies achieve "insurtech unicorn" status by:
- Raising $1 billion in capital or reaching a $1 billion valuation
- Securing funding from top venture capital investors This comprehensive overview shows how insurtech is fundamentally transforming the traditional insurance industry through technological innovation and digital transformation.

The sector continues to grow rapidly while offering increasingly sophisticated solutions for both insurers and consumers.

speakers.companyProfile:
Company Overview:
GreenieRE is an impact insurer focused on reinsuring policies that support the clean energy transition.

The company was created through collaboration between multiple stakeholders including Energetic Capital, the Coalition for Green Capital, InnSure, and kWh Analytics.

• 

Recent Developments:
In January 2025, GreenieRE received a $200 million investment from the Coalition for Green Capital (CGC). Over the next decade, GreenieRE is projected to unlock over $30 billion in private-sector investment for qualified clean energy projects.

• 

Business Model and Services:
- Insurance Structure: GreenieRE policies are primarily underwritten and issued by Managing General Agents (MGAs).

This model maximizes comparative advantage across the insurance value chain, with MGAs leading insurance innovation and developing new products and novel underwriting approaches to address risks.

• Core Services: The company:
- Collaborates with traditional insurers to support clean energy developers and financial institutions
- Helps de-risk projects through expert underwriting and impact finance partnerships
- Offers scalable and replicable insurance contracts to attract additional capital and drive market confidence in clean energy investments 4.

Market Focus and Impact:
GreenieRE addresses key risks that hinder the development of decarbonization infrastructure by:
- Offering customized insurance solutions to reduce investment risks
- Speeding up clean energy projects
- Ensuring at least 50% of its insured value supports underserved communities 5.

Leadership:
The company is led by CEO Jeff McAulay, who emphasizes their focus on:
- Providing high-impact risk management solutions
- Efficient use of federal funding
- Maximizing impact for end users 6. Market Challenge Addressed:
GreenieRE addresses a significant market gap, as a major obstacle for advancing clean energy projects has been the lack of affordable and comprehensive insurance.

Green banks, community lenders, and other financial institutions have faced challenges in securing insurance products that accurately assess risk, which is essential for attracting private sector capital.

• 

Organizational Structure:
GreenieRE is structured as:
- A non-profit with a wholly-owned licensed industry association captive
- Domiciled in Vermont
- Partners with expert underwriters URLs:
- Main website: www. GreenieRE. org
- Parent organization: www. coalitionforgreencapital. com This summary represents the most current information available about GreenieRE's operations and mission in the clean energy insurance sector.

speakers.companyProfile:
Overview:
Insurtech refers to the innovative use of technology to improve and streamline the insurance industry.

It encompasses digital platforms for policy purchasing and claims processing, as well as complex data analytics for improved risk management and underwriting.

• 

Key Technologies and Innovations:
- The insurance industry is rapidly transforming through the integration of:
- Generative AI
- Blockchain
- Internet of Things (IoT)
These technologies are making insurance more accessible, efficient, and personalized.

• 

Market Trends:
- Key trends include:
- More personalized insurance plans driven by AI and machine learning
- Rise in usage-based insurance with premiums based on real-time data from IoT devices 5. Industry Challenges:
Major challenges include:
- Securing funding for growth and development
- Significant investment requirements for technology development
- Regulatory compliance
- Customer attraction costs 6.

Technology Integration:
Key challenges in technology integration include:
- Technical and financial challenges in integrating new technologies
- Legacy systems compatibility issues
- Problems for startups trying to innovate and provide seamless solutions 7.

Future Outlook:
The insurtech trends of 2025 indicate an industry undergoing tech-driven transformation, with:
- AI, IoT, and data analytics enabling unprecedented capabilities
- Automation of back-office processes
- Delivery of personalized experiences
Success requires modern, flexible architectures and focus on data quality, security, and ethics 8.

Key Benefits for Industry:
Organizations that effectively implement insurtech solutions can achieve:
- Lower operating costs
- Faster go-to-market with new products
- Improved risk accuracy
- Higher customer satisfaction
Those who successfully combine cutting-edge tech with core insurance expertise are positioning themselves as industry leaders 9.

Recent Innovations:
In 2025, tech-enabled MGAs (Managing General Agents) are advancing proprietary in-house AI insurance solutions tailored to specific markets, with global carriers and reinsurers increasingly partnering with insurtechs to deliver AI solutions.

speakers.companyProfile:
Company Overview:
InsureMO is an insurance middleware platform that enables the digitization of insurance applications, APIs, and ecosystems, allowing insurers and channels to connect products.

The company serves the insurance industry, including insurance carriers, brokers, agents, and insurtech startups.

Key Statistics:
- The platform manages over 65 million policies and has facilitated more than US$25 billion in Gross Written Premium (GWP) through its cloud platform.

• The platform features 17,500+ products and 10,000+ APIs, enabling seamless connectivity across ecosystems.

• 

Technology and Services: Core Platform Features:
- Built on a microservices-based, API-first, cloud-native, and headless (MACH) architecture, processing high volumes of transactions efficiently
- Key components include product engines, microservices for policy, claims, payment and more Services:
- Provides end-to-end UI-driven tools for manufacturing and managing insurance products portfolio in a low-code/no-code manner
- Features powerful design tools for customizing and maintaining insurance products with digital API generation, allowing quick launch of any product, channel or application using headless APIs 3. Recent Developments: Recent Partnership:
EXL has formed a significant partnership with InsureMO, enhancing its position in the insurance technology space. This collaboration allows insurers to modernize their core systems more efficiently, reducing disruption and operational costs. A leading insurer using this integration launched a new product and reduced operational costs by approximately 30% in just four weeks.

Integration Capabilities:
InsureMO's middleware integrates seamlessly with major global placement platforms, including PSC, Ebix, Steadfast, and the London market, expanding insurers' reach and operational agility.

• 

Market Position: Customers and Reach:
- Notable customers include Ageas, Chubb and SBIG
- The platform addresses a critical pain point in the insurance industry: the need to innovate without disrupting existing operations. It specifically tackles challenges where legacy systems impede digital transformation, offering incremental modernization instead of high-risk, costly system replacements.

Innovation Focus:
The platform helps insurers move beyond monolithic systems and accelerate innovation across underwriting, policy administration, claims, and distribution. Relevant URLs:

- Oakland
- New Jersey
The company sells insurance products in 38 states.

Notable Achievements:
Under McCathron's leadership, Hippo launched the Hippo Builder Insurance Agency, implementing proprietary technology that enables quick partner integration, allowing new partner leads to be quoted in as little as two weeks.

Company Overview:
Hippo Holdings Inc is a home insurance group that created a new standard of care and protection for homeowners.

Key Business Segments:
The company has three reportable segments:

- Insurance-as-a-Service: Managed through Spinnaker subsidiary

Recent performance shows strong growth:
- First operating profit reported in Q2 2025
- Revenue rose 31% year-on-year to $117 million Financial highlights:
- Net income of $1 million (compared to $40 million loss in prior year)
- Adjusted net income of $17 million
- Cash and investments of $604 million
- Spinnaker Insurance surplus of $223 million 3.

Products and Services:
Hippo provides insurance coverage for:
- Computers
- Home offices
- Electronics
- Appliances
- Water backup
- Service line coverage Innovative Features:
Hippo differentiates itself by emphasizing home wellness, offering:
- Complimentary smart home system for new customers
- Discounts for smart home protection devices
- Free professional Hippo Home Care Service 4. Technology and Innovation:
Hippo utilizes advanced data analysis technologies including:
- AI
- Geographical information
- Aerial photo images
- Satellite images
- Weather information
- Real estate information
These technologies are used for underwriting decisions and loss prevention 5. Recent Developments:

- Will distribute new construction homeowners product through Baldwin's subsidiary
- Will accelerate growth of New Homes business
- Baldwin purchased Hippo's existing homebuilder distribution network for $100 million 6.

Market Position:
- Technology-enabled insurance group leveraging Spinnaker as hybrid fronting carrier
- Applies deep industry expertise and strong underwriting capabilities
- Well-positioned to adapt to changing market conditions and capitalize on market cycles 7.

Company Overview:
Hyland Software is a technology company specializing in content services and enterprise content management (ECM) solutions. Founded in 1991, the company develops platforms for efficient document, process, and information management.

2. Core Solutions and Services:
- Enterprise Content Management:
Hyland provides enterprise content services and management globally, offering future-adaptive, cloud-enabled technology that enables automation and helps optimize business systems and process workflows.

- Insurance-Specific Solutions:
Hyland's insurance software solutions:
- Streamline and automate daily processes
- Centralize claims information
- Streamline underwriting with intelligent case management
- Provide automated communications and mobile-friendly online forms

3. Technology Integration:
Hyland integrates with core insurance systems to provide:
- Document management
- Case management
- Process automation
- Prebuilt integrations for Guidewire and Duck Creek for claims, policy and billing applications

4. Digital Transformation Capabilities:
The company is heavily involved in digital transformation, with industry analysts noting that over 50% of insurance budgets are dedicated to digital transformation projects. Hyland offers modern, cloud-native and open-source technologies focused on automation and better customer results.

5. Market Position and Success:
Hyland serves over 14,000 organizations worldwide, focusing on operational efficiency and customer experience improvement. Their success is demonstrated by cases such as a global insurer saving $21 million over five years with Hyland's assistance.

6. Recent Acquisitions and Growth:
Key recent acquisitions include:
- Perceptive Business Unit from Lexmark International (2017)
- Alfresco Software (2020)
- Nuxeo (2021)

7. Cloud Capabilities:
Hyland offers cloud-based solutions through the Hyland Cloud, providing scalable and secure content services. Their platform enables faster innovation and reduced costs with content in the cloud.

8. Customer Experience:
Hyland's platform enables:
- Self-service maintenance for policyholders
- Mobile-friendly online forms
- Consistent omnichannel experiences across phone, online, mobile, and mail channels

Key URLs:

speakers.name: Sandeep Haridas
speakers.companyProfile:
Company Overview:
IntellectAI is part of Intellect Design Arena, which offers a full spectrum of banking and insurance technology products through four main business lines.

Key Characteristics:
- IntellectAI has been working with insurers globally for over two decades, providing cloud-native, AI-enabled and data-centric underwriting products for reinsurers, wholesalers and MGAs.

• They serve over 325+ customers worldwide, supported by solution architects and domain experts in major global financial hubs.

• The company is known for pioneering Design Thinking principles, with their 8012 FinTech Design Center being the world's first Design Center dedicated to these principles.

• 

Core Products and Services: Magic Submission:
- This AI-enabled extraction tool:
- Reads both structured and unstructured documents across all lines of business
- Automatically classifies documents based on text and images
- Extracts relevant information and performs global clearance rules checks
- Normalizes submission data to target carrier data models
- Enriches data with additional exposure data from external sources Risk Analyst:
This is a data aggregation and insights platform featuring:
- Generative AI assistance for enhanced underwriter productivity
- Data triangulation from thousands of structured and unstructured sources
- Submission data validation
- ESG insights with custom scoring
- Generative AI-powered summaries and recommendations
The solution reduces underwriting decision-making time by 60% Xponent:
This is a full suite, end-to-end P&C underwriting workbench that includes:
- Submission ingestion
- Full policy administration support for more than 11 lines of business
It's notably one of the only fully built-out underwriting workbenches in the marketplace 3. Recent Innovations: They've recently launched the world's first no-touch loss run extraction technology, leveraging Gen AI within their proprietary eMACH. ai framework. This technology can process data from loss runs instantly with over 95% accuracy across various document formats, including handwritten notes, Excel files, images, and PDFs.

• 

Market Position and Impact: - IntellectAI has achieved #1 ranking in InsurTech for two consecutive years.

• They take an "Underwriter first" approach to underwriting transformation, with cloud-native, embedded AI-driven, pre-built products that can rapidly change the digital transformation trajectory for Reinsurers, Wholesalers and MGAs.

• 

Future Developments: IntellectAI is developing:
- A standalone end-to-end ecosystem for cyber carriers
- Magic Placement solution for rapid analysis and error checks between policies through a hands-free process 6.

speakers.name: Sofia Belmar
speakers.profileSummary:
Current Role:
Sofia Belmar-Berumen was recently appointed as the new president and CEO of Prudential Seguros Mexico (POM).

Company Background:
Prudential Financial is one of the world's largest financial services institutions with over 140 years of history, offering a wide array of financial products and services to individual and institutional clients.

The company has operations across the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America.

Professional Experience and Expertise:
She has been involved in the transformation of the insurance industry, particularly in the technology sector.

Her work has focused on:
- Digital Insurance initiatives, moving services online and enhancing customer experience
- Connected Insurance, implementing IoT for personalized and preventive solutions
- Leading the transition into Generative Insurance powered by AI, which is transforming how policies are created, priced, and managed.

Leadership and Recognition:
Sofia has been recognized for her deep market expertise in the insurance industry, and she has been featured in prominent business publications, including being listed among the 100 most influential leaders in Mexico according to Revista Expansión.

Industry Focus:
She has been particularly active in transforming insurance technology, having held leadership positions including the presidency of the IT Committee at AMIS (Mexican Association of Insurance Institutions).

The available search results suggest that Sofia Belmar is a prominent figure in the Mexican insurance industry with particular expertise in digital transformation and insurtech innovation.

Her appointment as CEO of Prudential Seguros Mexico represents a significant leadership role in one of the world's largest financial services organizations. URLs and Professional Presence:

speakers.name: Tanguy Catlin
speakers.profileSummary:
Current Role and Position:
He currently serves as a Senior Partner at McKinsey & Company, focusing on Private Capital, Life Sciences and Healthcare, advising across asset classes. McKinsey is recognized as the largest top-tier advisor to the private capital ecosystem.

Leadership and Expertise:
Tanguy helps companies develop their digital capabilities to achieve rapid results and sustained growth.

He leads McKinsey Digital hubs across North America and Mexico.

Areas of Focus and Expertise:
His client work involves:
- Analytics transformations
- Digitally enabled business model transformations
- Core-technology-modernization programs Previous Roles and Experience:
He previously led McKinsey's property and casualty insurance work in North America.

He has served as an Active Board Member for Public, Private and Not-for-Profit companies, and is a former Chairman of McKinsey & Company in North America.

He joined McKinsey & Company in September 2011. Notable Work and Contributions:
He has co-authored significant research on how insurers can become digital firms and create value in the digital age. His research with McKinsey colleagues has revealed important insights about economic profit distribution, showing a "power curve" that has steepened over the past decade. Their research demonstrates that digital revenue growth has become negative for companies in the bottom three quartiles while increasing for the top quartile, with digital competition having twice the negative impact on earnings growth for companies in the bottom three-quarters compared to top performers.

Industry Focus:
He has been particularly involved in the evolution of the insurance industry and insurtech developments. Location:
He is based in Newton and has over 500+ connections on LinkedIn.

This profile presents Tanguy Catlin as a senior leader at McKinsey & Company with extensive experience in digital transformation, insurance, and business strategy, who has held significant leadership positions and contributed to important research in these fields. URLs found:
- LinkedIn Profile: https://www. linkedin. com/in/tanguycatlin/
- Author Page: https://www. linkedin.

Market Trends and Future Focus: Recent developments include:
